content: Both House and Senate bills for the National Defense Authorization Act for FY2012 address detainee issues at Guantanamo Bay and counterterrorism measures. The Senate passed S. 1867 on December 1, 2011, incorporating provisions from S. 1253. Differences between the House and Senate versions will be resolved in conference. The White House has criticized aspects of both bills and threatened to veto any legislation that limits the President's authority. The White House has criticized aspects of both House and Senate bills for the National Defense Authorization Act for FY2012 and has threatened to veto any legislation that limits the President's authority on intelligence collection, terrorist incapacitation, and national protection. The bills aim to confirm or expand the detention authority granted to the President post-9/11 attacks through the Authorization for Use of Military Force.
